trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Aha! | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Aha! | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Aha! with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Aha! with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Aha!
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Aha!

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Aha!
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Aha!

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: An Aha!
trans-unit.target: An Aha!

trans-unit.source: single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Aha!
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Aha!

trans-unit.source: will be able to single sign into the application at your Aha!
trans-unit.target: will be able to single sign into the application at your Aha!

trans-unit.source: company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Aha!
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Aha!

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Aha!
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Aha!

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Aha!.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Aha!.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Aha!, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Aha!, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Aha!.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Aha!.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Aha!, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Aha!, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Aha!</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Aha!</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Aha!
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Aha!

trans-unit.source: with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Aha! application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Aha! application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Aha! page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Aha! page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the **Aha!
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the **Aha!

trans-unit.source: Sign On URL** textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign-on to your Aha!
trans-unit.target: Sign On URL** textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign-on to your Aha!

trans-unit.source: Application (e.g.: "https://company.aha.io/session/new"), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Application (e.g.: "https://company.aha.io/session/new"), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Aha! page, to download your metadata file, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Aha! page, to download your metadata file, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Aha!
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Aha!

trans-unit.source: company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Account.
trans-unit.target: Click Account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Profile</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Profile</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Security and single sign-on.
trans-unit.target: Click Security and single sign-on.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Security and single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Security and single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Single Sign-On section, as Identity Provider, select SAML2.0.
trans-unit.target: In Single Sign-On section, as Identity Provider, select SAML2.0.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Security and single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Security and single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Single Sign-On configuration page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Single Sign-On configuration page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Name textbox, type a name for your configuration.
trans-unit.target: In the Name textbox, type a name for your configuration.

trans-unit.source: For Configure using, select Metadata File.
trans-unit.target: For Configure using, select Metadata File.

trans-unit.source: To upload your downloaded metadata file, click Browse.
trans-unit.target: To upload your downloaded metadata file, click Browse.

trans-unit.source: Click Update.
trans-unit.target: Click Update.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Aha!, they must be provisioned into Aha!.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Aha!, they must be provisioned into Aha!.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Aha!, provisioning is an automated task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Aha!, provisioning is an automated task.

trans-unit.source: There is no action item for you.
trans-unit.target: There is no action item for you.

trans-unit.source: Users are automatically created if necessary during the first single sign-on attempt.
trans-unit.target: Users are automatically created if necessary during the first single sign-on attempt.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Aha!
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Aha!

trans-unit.source: user account creation tools or APIs provided by Aha!
trans-unit.target: user account creation tools or APIs provided by Aha!

trans-unit.source: to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to Aha!, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to Aha!, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the **Aha!
trans-unit.target: On the **Aha!

trans-unit.source: application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
